html:
Home Prices Are Rising at the Slowest Rate in Nearly Two Years

A national index of U.S. home prices rose 2.7% in the 12 months to April, as high mortgage rates continued to bite.

That was the slowest annual rate of growth since mid-2023, and down from 3.4% as of March.

ðŸ”Ž More homeowners are finding they owe more on their mortgages than their properties are worth. Read more:
